text: Signal transduction by <extra_id_0> DR3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , a death domain - containing receptor related to <extra_id_0> TNFR-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> CD95 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

<extra_id_0> Tumor necrosis factor receptor-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNFR-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and <extra_id_0> CD95 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( also called <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or <extra_id_0> APO-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) are cytokine receptors that engage the apoptosis pathway through a region of intracellular homology , designated the " death domain . "

Another death domain - containing member of the TNFR family , <extra_id_0> death receptor 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> DR3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , was identified and was shown to induce both apoptosis and activation of nuclear factor kappaB .
Expression of <extra_id_0> DR3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> appears to be restricted to tissues enriched in lymphocytes .

<extra_id_0> DR3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> signal transduction is mediated by a complex of intracellular signaling molecules including <extra_id_0> TRADD <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> TRAF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> FADD <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> FLICE <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Thus , <extra_id_0> DR3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> likely plays a role in regulating lymphocyte homeostasis .
